content.webTitle: Matt Harvey says sorry to Mets after admitting: I stayed out late on Friday

fields.headline: Matt Harvey says sorry to Mets after admitting: I stayed out late on Friday
fields.bodyText: Mets pitcher Matt Harvey apologised to his team-mates on Tuesday after revealing the reason for his no-show on Saturday: he stayed out past curfew on Friday night. Harvey gave a contrite press conference at Citi Field in which he admitted to being “extremely embarrassed” by failing to show for the game against the Marlins – a no-show that led to the club imposing a three-match suspension on the 28-year-old. He confirmed he had been partying with friends on Friday and said he had put himself “in a bad place to be ready to show up for a ballgame”. Harvey said: “First off, as I just did with my team-mates and all the coaches, I apologised for my actions and I do apologise for my actions. Obviously I’m extremely embarrassed by my actions.” He went on: “Yes, I was out on Friday night, past curfew. I did play golf Saturday morning and I put myself in a bad place to be ready to show up for a ballgame. It is my responsibility and I take full blame for that.” According to reports, Harvey failed to turn up for batting practice on Saturday afternoon. He said he had a migraine. Team personnel were reportedly sent to his Manhattan apartment at about 10pm on Saturday night. When he arrived on Sunday for what would have been his turn in the rotation, Harvey was told he was suspended for three games, retroactive to Saturday. Harvey said he had taken on board the lessons of the weekend. He said: “People make mistakes, and there are things I have realized the last couple days … and one of those should be doing is putting myself in a better place to perform physically.” Harvey was asked whether he would file a grievance. “I’ve been more embarrassed about my actions and thinking about the team more than anything. Filing anything – I have not done [that]. Whether or not it happens down the road isn’t on my mind.” Harvey, who was supposed to start Sunday’s game, is now set to make his next start on Friday in Milwaukee. He said: “I’m looking forward to getting everything back on track and helping this organization moving forward said. They have my word on that.”
